Package sru.edu.group1.workorders.controller

Class ManagerController

java.lang.Object
sru.edu.group1.workorders.controller.ManagerController
@Controller @RequestMapping("/manager") public class ManagerController extends Object
This is the controller for the Manager role of the project. Managers are able to control the incident side of the project. Able to create, edit, delete, and assign technicians to any incident.
Author:
Trevor Bell trevorbell030@gmail.com, Ellie Wurst, John Friend, Hunter Minteer

    • viewManagerPage

      @GetMapping("/Landing") public String viewManagerPage(@CurrentSecurityContext(expression="authentication?.name") String username, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      The landing page for the Manager roles, has a list of buttons for all of their options, including excel file uploading and the connection of data
      Parameters:
      username - holds the logged in user to display
      model - passes information to the HTML page.
      Returns:

    • managerIncidents

      @GetMapping("/managerIncidentList") public String managerIncidents(@CurrentSecurityContext(expression="authentication?.name") String username, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.ui.Model model2, org.springframework.ui.Model techUsers)
      A list of all incidents in the DB, for the manager to look at, there are options such as assign technician as well
      Parameters:
      username - holds a username from the logged in user
      model - holds the username to pass to the HTML page
      model2 - holds the incidents to pass to the HTML page
      techUsers - holds all accounts with the tech role
      Returns:
      a list of all the incidents with certain options avaliable

    • newManagerIncidentForm

      @GetMapping("/incidentReport") public String newManagerIncidentForm(@CurrentSecurityContext(expression="authentication?.name") String username, org.springframework.ui.Model incident, org.springframework.ui.Model building, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      when a manager needs to submit a report form, instead of using the FAQ, this is the page they will go to.
      Parameters:
      incident - holds the information to save to the DB
      building - pulls the building information to show in the HTML page
      Returns:
      a page to submit a new incident

    • saveManagerIncident

      @PostMapping("/managerIncidentSave") public String saveManagerIncident(@ModelAttribute("incidents") Incidents incidents, @CurrentSecurityContext(expression="authentication?.name") String username, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult, Users user, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request) throws UnsupportedEncodingException, jakarta.mail.MessagingException
      this is what happens when a manager goes to submit an incident, it saves it in the database
      Parameters:
      incidents - holds incident information to save to the DB
      bindingResult - holds errors about validation
      user - holds user information, to get an email to send to the user once they submit the issue
      request - holds data for HTTP services
      Returns:
      an incident success page that will let them return to the landing page or see their incidents
      Throws:
      UnsupportedEncodingException - holds error information for encoding methods
      jakarta.mail.MessagingException - holds error information for basic messaging methods

    • saveManagerAssign

      @RequestMapping("/managerIncidentAssign/{report_id}") public String saveManagerAssign(@PathVariable(name="report_id") Long report_id, @RequestParam("assign") String assign, org.springframework.ui.Model incident, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request) throws UnsupportedEncodingException, jakarta.mail.MessagingException
      Located on the managerIncidentList page that allows managers to assign technicians to reports
      Parameters:
      report_id - holds the id of the report that was selected
      assign - hold the email of the tech that was selected for assignment
      incident -
      request - holds data for HTTP services
      incident - holds all incident information
      Throws:
      UnsupportedEncodingException - holds error information for encoding methods
      jakarta.mail.MessagingException - holds error information for basic messaging methods

    • managerCloseIncident

      @RequestMapping("/closeIncident/{report_id}") public String managerCloseIncident(@PathVariable(name="report_id") Long report_id, org.springframework.ui.Model incident, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request) throws UnsupportedEncodingException, jakarta.mail.MessagingException
      once assigned, a manager will then gain the option to close an incident, or list that they it has been completed After that the user who submitted the incident will get an email saying it has been completed
      Parameters:
      report_id - holds the id of the report that was selected
      incident - holds all incident information
      request - holds information for HTTP requests such as sending an email
      Returns:
      the manger will return to the incident page, with the incident now marked as closed
      Throws:
      UnsupportedEncodingException - holds error information for encoding methods
      jakarta.mail.MessagingException - holds error information for basic messaging methods

    • connectData

      @GetMapping("/dataConnect") public String connectData(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This will show all current information regarding buildings, departments, and rooms in the Database, And allows a manager to connect a buildling with Rooms and Departments.
      Parameters:
      model - passes all needed information to the HTML page.
      Returns:
      the dataconnect page, this one is specific to manager, could be made universal by swapping it to the excel controller.
